title: If you a developer, must be known React.js key topics.
author: Uhai Mong
objective: React.js is a powerful JavaScript library for building user interfaces. To get started with React, there are several key topics that you should be familiar with

content.description: Components: React is based on a component-based architecture, where you break your UI into smaller reusable pieces. Components can be simple, like a button, or complex, like an entire form.
JSX: JSX is a syntax extension for JavaScript that allows you to write HTML-like code inside your JavaScript files. It makes it easy to write and maintain your UI code.
State: State is the internal data that a component uses to render itself. By updating the state, you can change how a component appears and behaves.
Props: Props are the inputs that a component receives from its parent. They allow you to pass data from one component to another.

Lifecycle methods: React provides a set of methods that allow you to hook into the lifecycle of a component. This can be useful for performing setup and teardown operations, or for handling updates to a component.
Routing: React Router is a popular library for adding client-side routing to your React applications. It allows you to define routes and switch between them without reloading the page.
Redux: Redux is a state management library for React. It provides a centralized store where you can manage your application's state and make it available to your components.
Hooks: React Hooks are a way to add state and lifecycle methods to functional components. They allow you to reuse stateful logic across multiple components.

summery: By mastering these key topics, you'll have a strong foundation for building powerful, dynamic user interfaces with React.
